intro: Pterocyclus angelicoides, commonly known as the angel's shield, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
